name: Jyothi Yarraji
biography: Jyothi Yarraji is an Indian track and field athlete specializing in the 100 meters hurdles. She currently holds the Indian national record in this event, which she broke on May 10, 2022 with a time of 13.23 seconds[1][5]. Yarraji has consistently surpassed this record on multiple occasions[2].
childhood: Jyothi Yarraji was born into a family facing financial difficulties in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Her father Suryanarayana works as a private security guard and her mother Kumari is a part-time cleaner at a hospital[2][4].
professional_career: Yarraji's career breakthrough came in 2015 when she won gold at the Andhra Pradesh inter-district meet[4]. She later trained at the SAI Centre in Hyderabad under coach N Ramesh[2][4]. In 2019, she moved to the Odisha Reliance Athletics High-Performance Centre in Bhubaneswar where she began training under British coach James Hillier[2][4].Yarraji has represented India at major international competitions. In 2022, she won silver in the 100m hurdles at the Asian Games[5] and competed at the Commonwealth Games[2]. She has also won multiple gold medals at the National Games[2]. In 2023, Yarraji broke the national indoor 60m hurdles record five times and won silver at the Asian Indoor Athletics Championships[5].
